Done the moderated code review with team and updating the first set of review comments.
Done the moderated code review with team and updating the second set of review comments.
Add a try catch for getDMAFd
Change it to std::optional and return null. Change all places where we return null.
Move this to Line no 735. Define where you use
move this also to 735
Change these three initialisations to brace type. Make it as one line instead of 3.
Create a separate function with existing and new xdma function. Get rid of the nonblockingmode parameter.
Throw runtime exception incase of error
Fix all the doxygen issues
Change the naming convention of variables
See whether we can use normal pointers instead of unique_ptr ?
See whether we can use normal pointers instead of unique_ptr ?
Add a try catch ?
Change the data type
Make it void return type
Remove this
Remove it
Recheck on the header file inclusions and remove unwanted ones
reuse the existing using
add class description here
All the types of constructor's can be deleted
Instead of host please use remote pldm terminus
try to add a common function here
Before sendmsg, insert the message into the flight recorder
Use LG2 for tracing. Add perror rather than errno.
Change the return type too
please change indx to index. uint32_t is implicitly changed to signed integer. Please correct it.
take care of data type conversion
for loop change to range based

since we are checking key inside map to generate unique key and map.find function check key is present or not and it's return key, but range based for loop returns single element of map so can't possible to check every key so as per old logic is easy to identify unique key.
Use requestMap.contains here
map doesn't have contain member function.
Use the unordered map
unique key generation is more faster if map data is sorted so don't want to use unordered map.
Use proper file naming convention
assign null
Avoid use of ifdef OEM_IBM , use the respInterface nullptr check call the set API

I don't think it's possible for anyone to convince themselves that this patch is correct, it is too large and deals with too many details. please break it up into smaller, self-contained commits that build towards solving the problem.

Hi Andrew,
Earlier @manoj also suggested the same but the event loop functionality is used by all child class to transfer data so just thinking if i can divide separate commit like this:
1: Adding transport mechanism from PLDM to Host(pldmd/pldm_resp_interface.hpp)
2. Adding signature changes for filehandler parent+child class but it uses old transfer mechanism (oem/ibm/libpldmresponder/file_io_by_type.hpp) 
3. Adding event loop mechanism to transfer data and uses above commit signature changes which completes full functionality.

@andrew @manoj  please share your thought on this.
Yeah, any separation of the functionality is an improvement. Let's aim for the division you suggest and see if it's any easier to work through the patches.
This is still a massive change? Can we split it up as discussed previously?

@andrew
as per previous comment i was trying to segregate code in 3 review but problem is review 2 and review 3 has function signature change which will compile time error and review 2 & 3 does not have much difference, so i segregate whole code in 2 review.
review 1: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/66754/2
review 2: current review (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/63950)
the above design is tightly coupled with virtual classes and change in base class reflect all child class that's why mainly it's appear as massive change.
there are 4 files(file_io.h, file_io.cpp, file_io_by_type.hpp, file_io_by_type.cpp) which has major change and cannot be segregated.
